cds::lock::AutoUnlock< T > Class Template Reference

Detailed Description

template<class T>
class cds::lock::AutoUnlock< T >

Auto unlocker.

T is lock type with one method: unlock. The destructor calls unlock method. Unlike Auto class, the constructor of the class does not call lock function of its argument.

Auto unlocker is not copy-constructible.

The class is intended for exception-safe usage of lock primitive, for example: 

            cds::lock::Spin sp  ;
            ...
            if ( sp.tryLock() ) {
                // sp is locked
                cds::lock::AutoUnlock<cds::lock::Spin> aus(sp) ;
                // Now even if a exception has been thrown, the destructor of \p aus object unlocks the \p sp spin-lock correctly
                ...
            }

Constructor & Destructor Documentation

template<class T>
cds::lock::AutoUnlock< T >::AutoUnlock ( T &  src ) [inline]

Constructor The src object must be locked.

The constructor does not call src.lock().
